name: HumanLayer
headline: Human-in-the-Loop for AI Agents
description:
HumanLayer is an API that enables AI applications to contact humans for help, feedback, and approvals. One customer uses HumanLayer to ship DevOps agents that manage complex and risky workflows like production deployments and database migrations. 

We’re building HumanLayer because we know that the future of AI Applications is not gonna be humans sitting at a chat interface, the future is “outer loop” or “headless” agents, and our partners are building AI apps that invert the typical interaction paradigm. Autonomous agents are calling humans, not the other way around.

AI Agents are poised to disrupt the $4.6tn global labor market, but in order to make agents reliable today, and train them to be fully autonomous tomorrow, solutions like HumanLayer are an inevitable part of the AI Agent stack.

founders.name: Dexter Horthy, Founder
founders.description:
Building HumanLayer | started coding at 17 at NASA JPL. Spent 7 years as Engineer, SE, PM, Exec at Replicated, a series C dev tools startup. I worked on container orchestrators, helped teams like Hashicorp, DataStax, and H2O.ai deliver and ship their on-prem k8s products. Core improvements to developer experience for Replicated.

I stumbled on the Human-in-the-Loop-for-AI problem while building slack-based agents that managed SQL warehouses. In 3 weeks I pivoted to HumanLayer and launched an MVP

# Human in the Loop for AI Agents
HumanLayer is an API and SDK that enables AI Agents to contact humans for feedback, input, and approvals.
[![Y Combinator](https://humanlayer.dev/yc.svg)](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/www.ycombinator.com/launches/M8e-humanlayer-human-in-the-loop-for-ai-agents-and-beyond>)[Get Started](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/app.humanlayer.dev/auth/signup>)
## Get started in 5 minutes
Drop in the SDK and start building. Clean APIs that fit right into your stack, whether you're using Python, TypeScript, or rolling your own client.
PythonTypeScriptREST API
OpenAILangChainCrewAIControlflowFastAPIFlask
Copy```
import json
import logging

from openai import OpenAI
from humanlayer import HumanLayer

hl = HumanLayer.cloud(verbose=True)
PROMPT ="multiply 2 and 5, then add 32 to the result"
# add can be called without approvaldefadd(x:int, y:int)->int:"""Add two numbers together."""return x + y

# but multiply must be approved by a human@hl.require_approval()defmultiply(x:int, y:int)->int:"""multiply two numbers"""return x * y

math_tools_map ={"add": add,"multiply": multiply,}
math_tools_openai =[{"type":"function","function"...
```

Show more[View on GitHub](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/github.com/humanlayer/humanlayer/tree/main/examples/openai_client>)
## Trusted By Engineers At
[Cratejoy - Shop Subscription Boxes](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/www.cratejoy.com/>)[![Cased](https://cased.com/logo-white.svg)](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/cased.com>)[](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/revi.ai>)
## For builders obsessed with quality
"Inversion of the AI agent model — long-running processes that pause for human direction when necessary ... The demo Dex of @humanlayer_dev did at @AITinkerers in SF last week really stuck with me."
![kwindla](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Fkwindla.jpeg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**kwindla** @trydaily
![Company logo](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Fdaily.png&w=256&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
This is awesome! Can't wait to integrate this with OpenFunnel Agents
![Fenil Suchak](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Ffenil.jpeg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Fenil Suchak** @OpenFunnel
This is awesome! So instead of RLHF for Gen 1 (system 1), HumanLayer (YC F24) is analogous to "RLHF for Gen 2 (system 2)"
![Jerry Hsiang](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Fjerry.jpeg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Jerry Hsiang** Finance @Royal
Ever since I got hands-on with HumanLayer, I'm asking my whole team to think more about Agentic AI workflows - I used to think agents were not worth the effort to get them to production-grade reliability, but now I'm stoked on what is possible when you bring humans into the loop
![Vaibhav Gupta](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Fvaibhav.png&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Vaibhav Gupta** @Boundary (YC W23)
Thanks for making sure the AI Agents don't go Agent Smith on us
![Clint Dunn](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Fclint.jpeg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Clint Dunn** @Wilde
Everyone needs to check out humanlayer... dope software
![Kirby Winfield](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Fkirby.jpeg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Kirby Winfield** @Ascend
Hot take: If you're serious about AI you don't want someone making the "hard AI parts go away" You want someone making the NON CORE PARTS go away so ALL YOU DO is work on the hard parts. This is why I'm excited to try @humanlayer_dev
![Amir Elaguizy](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Famir.jpg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Amir Elaguizy** @amirpc
Really enjoying playing with @humanlayer_dev - instead of the manual outreach grind, I just hang out in slack and give the agent feedback as it finds new leads. Pretty darn cool @dexhorthy
![Tom Granot](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Favatars%2Ftom.jpeg&w=96&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
**Tom Granot** @TomGranot
## Support for your Favorite Framework + LLM
![Frameworks](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/static/media/frameworks.a4545c6b.svg)
## Key Features
### Require Human Approval for Function Calls
```
@hl.require_approval()
```
decorator blocks specific function calls until a human has been consulted - upon denial, feedback will be passed to the LLM.
### OmniChannel Contact
Contact humans and collect responses across Slack, Email, Discord, and more.
### Advanced Approvals
Coordinate approvals across multiple teams and individuals with escalations and timeouts.
### Human as Tool
```
hl.human_as_tool()
```
allows for contacting a human for answers, advice, or feedback.
### Granular Routing
Route approvals to specific teams or individuals.
### Bring your own LLM + Framework
Because HumanLayer is implemented at tools layer, it supports any LLM and all major orchestration frameworks that support tool calling.
## How it Works
### Approval Workflows
![Get running with SDK in 5 minutes](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fsdk.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
Get running with SDK in 5 minutes
![Guarantee human oversight of key function calls](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fhuman.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
Guarantee human oversight of key function calls
![On denial, feedback added to agent context window](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fchat.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
On denial, feedback added to agent context window
### Human as Tool
![Add a variety of human contact channels to your agent toolchain](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fsdk.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
Add a variety of human contact channels to your agent toolchain
Create asynchronous, outer-loop agent workflows
![Invert the flow of control, from human-initiated to agent-initiated](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fhuman.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
Invert the flow of control, from human-initiated to agent-initiated
### Custom Responses and Escalations
![Pre-fill response prompts for seamless human-agent interactions](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fhuman.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
Pre-fill response prompts for seamless human-agent interactions
![Route to specific individuals or teams, and control which users can approve or respond to LLM requests](https://humanlayer.dev/_next/image?url=%2Ficons%2Fchat.png&w=48&q=75&dpl=dpl_Gz5JKrC2Rp9jknbkoZFiMsgcgbvf)
Route to specific individuals or teams, and control which users can approve or respond to LLM requests
```
from humanlayer importHumanLayerhl =HumanLayer()
@hl.require_approval()def send_email(to: str, subject: str, body: str):"""Send an email to the customer"""...
def run_llm_task(prompt, tools, llm="gpt-4"):"""Your custom LLM task implementation"""...
run_llm_task(  prompt="Send an email welcoming the user to 
  the platform and encouraging them to...",  tools=[send_email],  llm="gpt-4o")
```
![human](https://humanlayer.dev/slack-conversation.png)
Watch the Deep Dive![play](https://humanlayer.dev/play-icon.svg)
## Plans & Pricing
$0/month
### Starter
Free forever for Hackers and Tinkerers
Works with all popular frameworks
100 operations/month
Pay as you go ($20/200 addt'l)
Send to Slack, Email, Discord
Up to 10 active users
Limited Data Retention
[Get Started](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/app.humanlayer.dev/auth/signup>)
$500/month
### Premium
Collaborate and scale
Remove HumanLayer Branding (BYO app/keys)
Includes 2000 operations/month ($18/200 add'l)
Advanced Approval Workflows w/ Escalations and Timeouts
Learning and Auto Approvals
Channels for MSTeams, SMS, RCS
Priority Support
180-day retention on feedback datasets export
[Let's Chat](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/cal.com/humanlayer/15min>)
Custom
### Enterprise
Deploy into your Private VPC or on-prem
RBAC and SSO support
Volume discounts
Custom notification channels
Expert Advice on custom-built agents for sales, marketing, hiring, and more.
[Let's Chat](https://humanlayer.dev/<https:/cal.com/humanlayer/15min>)
### Pricing FAQs
Can’t find the answer you’re looking for? Please chat with our team
#### What's an active user?
An active user is any user that is registered to approve or respond to agents.
#### Learning and Auto Approvals
Learning and Auto Approvals allow you to set a threshold for automatically approving or denying requests based on past human interactions.
#### Escalations and Timeouts
Escalations and Timeouts allow you to coordinate approvals across multiple teams and individuals with escalations and timeouts. Supports Promise.race() and Promise.all() semantics.
#### Exporting Datasets for Training and Evals
With HumanLayer, you can take the live feedback from your Human SMEs and periodically export it to one or more high-fidelity labeled datasets to power either fine-tuning, evals, or both.
#### Can't find the answer you're looking for?
Let's chat! - grab some time using one of the links above

generated_description:
**HumanLayer: Integrating Humans into AI Workflows**

Founded in 2023, HumanLayer is an innovative startup that's pushing the boundaries of how AI can collaborate with humans. Currently part of Y Combinator's Batch F24, they’ve developed a robust API and SDK that allows AI applications to contact humans for essential feedback, input, and approvals—what they call a "Human-in-the-Loop" system.

### Mission

HumanLayer's mission is crystal clear: they aim to make AI agents more reliable today and fully autonomous tomorrow by bridging the gap between humans and machines. As they envision it, the future of AI won't be about humans initiating interactions through a chat interface—instead, it will be about autonomous agents reaching out to humans for guidance when needed. This paradigm shift is vital, especially as AI agents start to challenge the enormous $4.6 trillion global labor market.

### What They Do

At its core, HumanLayer is designed for those who need robust oversight in their AI processes. One of their clients leverages HumanLayer to ship DevOps agents critical for managing complex tasks, such as database migrations and production deployments. They offer essential features like:

- **Human Approval for Function Calls**: Certain actions in AI functionality can be held for human approval. This ensures that complex tasks are handled with the necessary oversight.
- **OmniChannel Contact**: AI agents can seamlessly reach out across various platforms, including Slack, Email, and Discord.
- **Granular Routing**: Approvals can be directed to specific teams or individuals, maximizing efficiency and clarity.

This flexibility makes HumanLayer suitable for various industries, from tech to finance.

### Key Features

1. **Approval Workflows**: Ensure human oversight on crucial function calls, adapting based on feedback to improve agent training.
2. **Multi-Channel Interaction**: Facilitate communication with humans across preferred platforms.
3. **Advanced Approval Mechanics**: Enable complex workflows, such as team collaboration and time-based escalation of approvals.
4. **Integration with Existing LLMs**: HumanLayer is designed to work with any language model and major orchestration frameworks, ensuring versatility.

### Pricing

HumanLayer offers a couple of pricing tiers, including a **Starter Plan** at $0/month for hobbyists with limited needs, scaling up to a **Premium Plan** at $500/month for businesses that require robust collaboration tools. Custom enterprise solutions are also available for organizations needing tailored integrations.

### Future Outlook

With a small team of 1.0 employees and Dalton Caldwell as their Group Partner, HumanLayer is poised to make significant strides in how AI interacts with users. Their approach not only amplifies the capabilities of AI agents but also respects and redirects human expertise. If you’re keen on shaping the next generation of AI workflows, it’s worth checking out [HumanLayer's site](https://humanlayer.dev) and seeing how they integrate execution and feedback seamlessly—because in the world of AI, a little human touch goes a long way.
